name: Angular-Inarray-Filter
tagline: Filter results that are contained inside an array
body: ### Welcome to Angular-InArray-Filter repository. Clone this repository: ``` $ git clone https://github.com/alejandrocarrasco/angular-inarray-filter.git ``` If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch. ### Description In this repository you can find a filter for AngularJS to filter results that are contained inside an array. ### Usage To use this filter you have to: 1. Add the 'inArray' filter included in filters.js file directly to your filters folder/file 2. Use angular notation to filter your repeaters: * Filter by specific elements of the array: ```{{element.id}} ``` where **inArray** is the filter, **filterArray** (the first argument of this filter) is your array to match against, and "id" (second argument) is the element of the list you want to match against the array * Filter a plain array: ```{{element}} ``` where **inArray** is the filter, **filterArray** (the first argument of this filter) is your array to match against your plain array. ### Authors and Contributors This directive is created by Alejandro Carrasco (@alejandrocarrasco) and is released under the MIT License.
